summary: This document is an internal email chain from July 25, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel, forwarding news reports about Jeffrey Epstein being found injured in his jail cell. The emails discuss the incident being treated as a possible suicide attempt after he was denied bail.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; a convicted sex offender facing federal sex trafficking charges who was found injured in his jail cell.

events.title: Epstein Found Injured in Jail Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at a federal jail in Manhattan with marks on his neck, treated as a possible suicide attempt.

events.title: News Reports on Epstein Incident
events.description: ABC News and New York Times publish reports about Epstein being placed on suicide watch after the incident in jail.

locations: federal lockup in New York City
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his jail cell with injuries to his neck on or before July 23, 2019.
The incident was being treated by prison officials as a possible suicide attempt.
Epstein had been denied bail a week prior to this incident.
The document shows U.S. Attorney's Office personnel circulating news reports about the incident internally.
